title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored 32 points as the Boston Celtics edged out the Philadelphia 76ers 109-108 for their third straight win.
Anfernee Simons contributed significantly to the Celtics' victory, recording a team-high +23 in the box score.
The Celtics matched the 76ers in rebounds, each team collecting 56, with Boston securing more offensive boards 16-9.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox wore a bloodied Jackie Kennedy costume, sparking backlash over its controversial nature and political implications.
Fox claimed the costume was a statement about Jackie Kennedy's bravery and the complex juxtaposition of beauty and horror.
Jack Schlossberg criticized the costume as glorifying political violence, calling it 'disgusting, desperate and dangerous.'

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London will play against the Patriots after missing last week's game.
Penix and London returned to full practice participation Friday, following limited sessions earlier in the week.
The Falcons face the Patriots, who are on a five-game win streak, as they aim to end a two-game losing streak.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow sees the Red Sox in a better position to acquire key players after making the 2025 playoffs.
The Red Sox face potential roster gaps with Alex Bregman's opt-out and options for Lucas Giolito and Trevor Story.
Boston is $25 million under the first luxury tax threshold, bolstered by a strong farm system and emerging talents.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel dismissed the notion that Patriots' recent changes seek to distance from past successes.
Patriots introduced offensive starters individually before Week 8 win, breaking a 24-year tradition.
Patriots lead AFC East at 6-2 despite some cultural changes causing initial mishaps.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will miss several weeks due to a lower-body injury sustained during a game against the Buffalo Sabres.
Bruins head coach Marco Sturm confirmed that Marat Khusnutdinov will take over as first-line center during Lindholm's absence.
Khusnutdinov scored the overtime winner against the Sabres and will line up with David Pastrnak and Morgan Geekie.

title: Photos: The best moments from Salem on Halloween 2025
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Thousands of tourists in full costume flood Salem, Massachusetts, for Halloween, the city's busiest day of the year.
Essex Street in Salem is bustling with street performances, spooky decorations, and Halloween-themed restaurants and shops.
Salem's historic sites, including the Salem Witch Museum and the Witch Trials Memorial, attract costumed visitors on Halloween.

title: Moulton, without proof, accuses Trump of abusing girls with Epstein in tense TV interview
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Rep. Seth Moulton claims President Trump is in 'Epstein files' and accuses him of abusing girls with Epstein.
Moulton made the accusations during an MSNBC interview, without providing evidence, leading to a tense exchange with Joe Scarborough.
Scarborough challenged Moulton's claims, emphasizing the lack of evidence and noting other issues surrounding Trump to discuss.

title: Brian Walshe’s next court appearance scheduled as cellphone evidence remains accessible
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Brian Walshe's murder trial is set to begin with jury selection on November 18 in Norfolk County.
A judge has preserved cellphone evidence linked to the federal probe, blocking its destruction before Walshe's trial.
Prosecutors and defense must submit final motions by next Friday, with hopes to conclude the trial by Christmas.

title: Star Market over the Mass. Pike reopens after asbestos scare
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Star Market in Newton reopened after being closed for three days due to an asbestos scare.
MassDEP confirmed asbestos was contained in a sealed stockroom, posing no risk to shoppers in the store.
Asbestos abatement work will continue in a contained area to ensure public safety, with no exposure risks.
